summary: The bill, titled the Suicide Prevention Assistance Act, amends the Public Health Service Act to establish a grant program for primary care offices. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will award grants to primary care offices to provide self-harm and suicide prevention services. Grant recipients will be required to hire clinical social workers, screen patients, provide short-term services, and make referrals for long-term care. The bill outlines grant terms, application processes, reporting requirements, and defines relevant terms. The Secretary must also develop standards of practice for screenings.
